intro: Crotalaria rigidula, commonly known as rigid spurred crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and compound leaves. Its flowers are yellow with prominent red veins, and it produces small, elongated pods containing several seeds. Crotalaria rigidula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
